com.pi4j.component.potentiometer.microchip

Interface MicrochipPotentiometer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component, Potentiometer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MCP4431, MCP4432, MCP4441, MCP4442, MCP4451, MCP4452, MCP4461, MCP4462, MCP4531, MCP4532, MCP4541, MCP4542, MCP4551, MCP4552, MCP4561, MCP4562, MCP4631, MCP4632, MCP4641, MCP4642, MCP4651, MCP4652, MCP4661, MCP4662, MicrochipPotentiometerBase

    public interface MicrochipPotentiometer
extends Potentiometer
    Abstract Pi4J-device for MCP45XX and MCP46XX ICs.
    Author:
    Raspelikan
    See Also:
    MCP4561, MCP4651

                   throws IOException
        Updates the cache to the wiper's value.
        Returns:
        The wiper's current value
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • setWiperLock

        void setWiperLock(boolean enabled)
           throws IOException
        Enables or disables wiper-lock. See chapter 5.3.
        Parameters:
        enabled - wiper-lock for the poti's channel has to be enabled
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • setWriteProtection

        void setWriteProtection(boolean enabled)
                 throws IOException
        Enables or disables write-protection for devices capable of non-volatile memory. Enabling write-protection does not only protect non-volatile wipers it also protects any other non-volatile information stored (f.e. wiper-locks).
        Parameters:
        enabled - write-protection has to be enabled
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if communication fails or device returned a malformed result

      • isChannelSupportedByDevice

        boolean isChannelSupportedByDevice(MicrochipPotentiometerChannel channel)
        Parameters:
        channel - A certain channel
        Returns:
        Whether the given channel is supported by the underlying device
